title: Black Bean and Corn Salad Recipe
description: This colorful black bean and corn salad has a refreshing lime and garlic dressing and makes a great side dish for any occasion.

Submitted by jen Updated on April 23, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 148 148 148 148 Prep Time: 25 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings ½ cup olive oil ⅓ cup fresh lime juice 1 clove garlic, minced 1 teaspoon salt ⅛ teaspoon ground cayenne pepper 2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained 1 ½ cups frozen corn kernels 1 avocado - peeled, pitted and diced 1 red bell pepper, chopped 2 tomatoes, chopped 6 green onions, thinly sliced ½ cup chopped fresh cilantro Directions Gather the ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place olive oil, lime juice, garlic, salt, and cayenne pepper in a small jar. Close the lid tightly and shake the jar until the dressing is well combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine beans, corn, avocado, bell pepper, tomatoes, green onions, and cilantro in a salad bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Shake dressing again, pour over salad, and toss to coat. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 2,737 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Black Bean and Corn Salad 01 of 148 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 148 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02/21/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Great taste ! Easy to prep , I left out the avocado as it’s not to our taste and added red onion left everything else as it is beautiful colours well worth giving it a go 03 of 148 Photo by  Alison 03/31/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser This recipe is delicious! I had to use little kidney beans instead of black beans because I didn't know I was out of black beans. It's just delicious make this! 04 of 148 Photo by  Dee 07/28/2023 Per others’ suggestions, I used 1/4 cup olive oil and 1/2 cup lime juice. A scant 1/4 cup of finely diced red onion replaced the scallions and I omitted the avacado. Fresh frozen bi-color corn added all the sweetness this recipe needed and my patio-grown mini grape tomatoes were added whole (1/2” minis!), keeping the veggies looking crisp. I was a hit with burgers for a summer patio barbeque. 05 of 148 Photo by  AmberWater9540 05/21/2023 Beautiful colors. Would make again! 06 of 148 Photo by  Ramled N 01/25/2022 My guests at Olievenhoutsrus Guest And Game Farm loved it 07 of 148 Photo by  Karen 07/30/2021 I couldn’t stop taste testing while I was making it! So delicious! I actually forgot the oil when I was making it and realized at the end I don’t think I really need it. All the flavors come through so nicely: the beans the corn the tomatoes the cilantro!
